Summary: The woman at the front desk (an Indian couple was working) was so absolutely rude to me when I went to check in that I decided to go to another hotel down the street. I had paid for the room and was assured I would get a refund. The couple shorted me 20$ of the cash I had handed to them for my deposit, which I noticed later, and my bank confirmed days later that they had never processed a refund for me. When I called about the refund her husband just kept asking me if I had ever gotten a receipt and then when he admitted he was the one who was working the desk that night he started insulting me in a very strange way over the phone, telling me he had done the “legal thing” and telling me to take it up with my bank. FRAUD.

Summary Heading: Rude staff and very questionable banking policies.
Summary: My stay here started out ok.  I was informed they were going to put a hold on $200 on my debit card for the $75 room. Thats annoying but ok. A few days later I had not recieved back the $200 hold on my debit card.  I called Oceanview motel to determine how long they thought it would take.  The gal who answered the phone was just about the most rude and unprofessional manager I've ever dealt with. I was not angry with her I simply wanted to get info on the policy as I had already talked to my bank who said they were waiting for the motel to release it.  She decided to hang up on me.  I called back and a gentleman answered,  asked my name and I guess set the phone down so I was talking to myself.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS MOTEL TO ANYONE!  THEY ARE NOT HELPFUL AND DO NOT WANT TO

Summary Heading: Best nights sleep on a 13 day vacation
Summary: I was looking for a budget hotel, and expected the worst due to these reviews...but I was tired and wanted a place between long beach and huntington beach cheap,  First , my deposit was put back on my account FAST, a plus....I walked in and the very nice Lady , did not ask her name ...was cooking something amazing...The price was very right...expected the room to be disgusting like Beverly L said...But last days on vacation and funds were getting low. and it was very clean..I'm giving this place a 5 star to help with these horrible reviews..is it a 5 star no, but is it a good place YES...worth a stop , such a comfortable bed no loud partiers and as a solo woman , I felt VERY safe...the beach you can walk to or park for free has the most beautiful  Private Beach for Sunsets (thus

Summary Heading: Staff is unkind and hung up on me
Summary: Hotel’s cancellation policy is there is no refund, even if you try to cancel 4 hours after making the reservation. Realized the hotel was too far away from where I needed to be after cancelling. I booked through hotels.com. When I called the hotel about a refund they told me that hotels.com is in charge if whether or not I get a refund. That’s completely false. Hotels.com needs the okay from the hotel in order to refund. They will not allow the refund to happen. Now I’m out $400. The hotel staff is very rude and short and would not let me talk when trying to ask questions. I was not being rude either, just trying to figure out how to get if not all, at least a portion of my $400 back.
Manager Response: Dear Samantha,  Thanks for your stay at the Oceanview Motel. We are very much concerned with your feedback. Our apologies for the bad experience. Our endeavor is to offer a nice stay to all our guests but failed this time. Actions shall be taken to improve everything on priority and you can have a good stay next time. I hope you will reconsider.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager.

Summary Heading: The most disgusting hotel we have ever been to.
Summary: We were touring America for 3 weeks. We booked via reserving with booking.com and over our 3 weeks have had no issues with their recommendations in the past. Arrived to the receptionist being beyond dismissive. She could not find our reservation and we requested to go onto the hotels WIFI to research the issue, she said we could not until we filled out her booking form which we duly did. We asked to checked the room first,  she refused to allows us too, we started to feel uncomfortable as she became more irritated. We used the restroom (which was one of the deluxe rooms) it was so dirty, paint peeling from the walls, and so not fit for purpose. She charged our card, we then decided upon viewing her establishment that we did not feel safe to stay there and asked her to refund the
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your review and for staying at the Oceanview Motel  We appreciate your feedback. Please allow me to offer our apologies for the inconveniences that impacted your stay. Your observations has been taken up by a team for verification and necessary actions. It shall be our endeavor to offer a fantastic experience to all our guests but regret that this was not the case with your stay. If you would like to get away in near future, I shall personally assist you to ensure that you get a fine stay as I don’t want your last memory of this hotel to be a negative one.  Regards, Hotel Manager.

Summary: SCAMMERS, LIARS, and will do anything possible to keep the $200 deposit on a $100 room. All I can say it’s not worth the $100. The owner/lady at the office is a horrid excuse for a human. She said she didn’t care that there was no damage to the room she was still keeping my deposit because 3 people stayed in our room. Only 2 actually did then called me a liar. Reading other reviews she will do anything to keep the crazy expensive $200 deposit. I told her I would dispute the charge and she said she didn’t care then cursed at me as we left. I don’t even know how this motel stays in business. Do yourself a favor and DONT deal with this horrid establishment.
Manager Response: Dear Esteemed Guest,  Thanks for your comments about your stay. I’m sorry that several issues combined to make your stay less than desirable. This is something unusual to hear, but still our sincere apologies. We take real pride in offering the best possible guest experience, and I understand that something might have gone wrong. You can be sure we’ll do better for you next time.  Nothing means more to us than providing a pleasant guest experience.  Sincerely, Hotel  Manager.

Summary: Staff was EXTREMELY rude, Margarita and other man. Upon check in, I was told that I was not allowed to have ANY visitors. Margarita threatened me, and said if my friend stayed, even for a few minutes, she would keep my $200 deposit.  I told her that my friend is going to walk to the room, to take a look at it with me, she kept reiterating that I will lose my deposit.  Upon going to the room, the room was not clean, and I did not feel safe being there.  So I went back to Margarita, and let her know that room was not cleaned, and she kept yelling at me, saying that we clean EVERY room. I let her know that I didn't feel safe there, she said too bad, there is nothing she can do, but will still keep my money.  I asked for a receipt reflecting that I checked in, and checked right out,
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with such candid feedback of your stay.  I am very sorry to hear that we could not meet your expectations.  On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for the problems you experienced while staying at our hotel.  We would like to thank you for bringing these issues to our attention so that we can resolve these problems as quickly as possible.  Again we are sorry you had a bad experience and we hope that you will consider staying with us again. We shall ensure that you have an awesome stay.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager

Summary: First of all there is NO view of the ocean. The rooms are incredibly tiny. We stayed in a “queen” room and there was barely any room to stand or walk to the bathroom. EXTREMELY expensive for a view of the Pacific Coast Highway and the back of private houses. Almost $600 for three nights. The front desk service was terrible and it seemed they wanted to get us out ASAP.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We’re sorry you were disappointed with the value of your accommodations. Our pricing is competitive with other hotels in the area and pricing can fluctuate as business commands. Front desk staff received additional training in the courteous, helpful manner in which they are to treat our valued guests. Thank you for being our guest and please reconsider us the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely Hotel Manager

Summary: HORRIBLE STAFF. While attempting to check in, the horrid woman at the front desk asked for sensitive information, my social security number. When I asked if she needed my mother’s maiden name as well she started pointing her finger in my face and yelling in broken English. I found better accommodations elsewhere. Total scam artists running the place, and with such a cheap, run-down looking property.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Greetings from the Oceanview Motel. We are very much concerned with your feedback. Our apologies for the bad experience. Our endeavor is to offer a nice stay to all our guests but failed this time. Actions shall be taken to improve everything on priority and you can have a good stay next time. Hope you will reconsider.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager.

Summary: There is no Oceanview from this hotel. All you see is the PCH (CA Highway 1) with 6 lanes and a wall on the other side of the street, which even reflects the noise to your room. The traffic on PCH never stops.  If you want to sleep in the middle of the PCH, go there!
Room tip: no tip, since I don't know any.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Greetings from the Oceanview Motel. We are very much concerned with your feedback. Our apologies for the bad experience. Our endeavor is to offer a nice stay to all our guests but failed this time. Actions shall be taken to improve everything on priority and you can have a good stay next time. Hope you will reconsider.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager.

Summary Heading: The most terrible place I have ever stayed
Summary: Rude, aggressive owners. Dilapidated room. Noisy. They steal your credit card details and keep on file along with a copy of your passport which they won’t return when you leave. Keep a 200 dollar deposit and accuse you of smoking in the room when you don’t smoke. Will never go near the place again. Stay away from this place.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are very sorry to read about the poor experience you had.  Please accept our sincere apologies, this is indeed very unfortunate.  Rest assured, I fully understand your disappointment and frustration due to the multiple issues you have mentioned.  We would like to inform that this is not a regular feature of our hospitality and we will properly check your comments with the team and implement appropriate solutions to please our guest.  I hope you do consider us again in the future as we would love the chance to change your impression of our property.   Sincerely, Hotel Manager.

Summary: Not a great motel unless your looking for a place just to pull in shower go to sleep and leave immediately in the morning. This place a strong mildew smell and mildew to provide the smell in the bathroom.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Greetings from the Oceanview Motel Huntington Beach. We are very much concerned with your feedback. Our apologies for the bad experience. Our endeavor is to offer a nice stay to all our guests but failed this time. Actions shall be taken to improve everything on priority and you can have a good stay next time. Hope you will reconsider.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager.

Summary: First of all this place is on the outskirts on Huntington Beach......... and not sure if it is actually in Huntington Beach or Seal Beach. It is right on Pacific Coast Highway (PCH) and the sound of traffic roaring up and down the road can be heard all night. Unless you’re a very sound sleeper this probably isn’t the best place to stay. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. There was a mini refrigerator and microwave in the room. You could catch a glimpse of the ocean between the houses across the highway if you’re on the upper floor.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thanks for staying at the Oceanview Motel during your recent visit to our area. We appreciate your review and the observations both positive as well as negative  They are precious to us and we shall surely take them for improvement.  We are addressing your observations point by point for further improvement and you shall definitely see the difference during your next visit. We await your earliest next trip to our area and promise a nice stay with us.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager.

Summary Heading: Clean Rooms Close Enough to Everything Fun In Seal Beach!
Summary: We had a nice stay the end of November 2018.  The room was clean, comfortable and just what we were looking for -- a place to sleep during our stay in Seal Beach.  It is conveniently located off the main road into Seal Beach and within walking distance to restaurants.  Staff was pleasant and went out of their way to call us when we left an item in the room after check-out.  We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  We truly value your feedback and it is highly encouraging. Our team prides itself on the experience we create for our guests and will be happy to hear that they have managed to satisfy you. We look forward to your repeated visit time and  making our hotel “Your home away from home” Once again, I wish to thank you for your encouraging feedback.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager.

Summary: There is no OCEAN VIEW. This is a disgusting 1 star motel at the beginning of Huntington Beach. No view, just a 4 lane highway in front. Staff unmotivated. Even just for one night I would strongly advise to chose another property. Martin, Germany
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thanks for your stay at the Oceanview Motel Huntington. Our apologies for all the inconveniences you had due to several issues. We are taking efforts to offer our guests a better stay, but somehow it has not worked for you. Your review is serious to us and we will take effective actions to check and rectify the mismatches and you can truly expect a better stay next time. Hope to see you back,  Sincerely, Hotel Manager.

Summary: Not on the oceanside of PCH, but just a short 10 minute drive to great beaches with lots of parking. "Ocean View" is technically correct, b ut all you see is a sliver of ocean between houses. No breakfast. All in all, not a great place, but not terrible either.
Manager Response: Hello Guest,  Greetings from the Oceanviiew Motel,Huntington. Thank you for the review of straight observations for improvements. We are improving our overall services. Look forward to meeting you again,  Sincerely, Hotel Manager.

Summary: They want to give the impression that the motel is oceanfront and that guests are well served, in cozy rooms.  The reality is that the motel overlooks the bustling pacific coast highway (also busy  at night). The noise of road traffic, in addition to the noise of other rude guests in the middle of the night, have greatly disturbed our sleep. The rooms are also badly insulated, as well as being ancient, unkempt, absolutely different from the photos reported by the property in the various sites (Booking.com, etc). They are smelly and not very hospitable! The owners' attitude (family management) is not very friendly; the impression is that they are interested in their income rather than offering hospitality and services aimed at satisfying clients. Finally, last but not least, the
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Greetings from the Ocean View Motel. We are very much concerned with your feedback. Our apologies for the bad experience. Our endeavor is to offer a nice stay to all our guests but failed this time. Actions shall be taken to improve everything on priority and you can have a good stay next time. Hope you will reconsider.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager.

Summary Heading: Absolutely disgusting. DO NOT STAY HERE
Summary: Please do not book here. These people are extremely unprofessional, unwelcoming, condescending and totally disrespectful with their clients. The lady at the desk was on the offence with us the second we walked in and could tell she didn’t want us there. Despite reading the history of poor reviews on their customer service, we thought we’d give them a chance. After the constant yelling and shouting at us within just 2 minutes of us arriving, I was told, “if you want nice customer service, you should’ve paid for 5 stars.” That is simply APPALLING. You’re in a customer-centric industry, and to treat the guests like rubbish the second they walk in is a shocking way of doing business.   Our requests were not unreasonable, as we arrived earlier than expected we were hoping to leave
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We’re pleased that you took the time to comment on our hotel so that we can respond to your concerns. I apologize that you had a bad experience at the desk and then found the room to be substandard. We have spoken with the desk clerk and understand that many things went wrong. We believe we have taken action to resolve the service issue and will reinspect the room as well. Your saw us at a bad moment, and I sincerely apologize. Everything we do is aimed at improving the guest experience. When you’re in the area again, we invite you to try us again. You can expect a much better experience in the future because we’re improving every day.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager

Summary: First of all,  there is no Ocean View from this motel. The room was bare bones with no amenities. We had to stop and purchase a bar of soap for showers.  We supposedly had a handicapped room, but we could not identify why it had that designation. The marquee advertised in room spas, but ours didn't have one. There was very few hangers to put away clothes and jackets and only one uncomfortable chair. If we travel to Huntington beach again, we will NOT be staying there.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thanks for your comments. I’m sorry that several issues combined to make your stay less than desirable. We take real pride in offering the best possible guest experience, and I understand that we let you down. You can be sure we’ll do better for you next time. Nothing means more to us than providing a pleasant guest experience.   Sincerely, Hotel Manager

Summary: Not in Hunting Beach Not on the beach Minimal Ocean View (between houses that are ACTUALLY on the beach) Rude staff Unwilling to accept a credit card to hold their $200 “bond” which is RIDICULOUS Wouldn’t accept quarters for a $1.50 water  Whatever you do, do not stay at this motel, find anywhere else!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I regret that we weren't a good match for your needs here in Huntington Beach at our well-regarded hotel. We take pride in satisfying many guests every day, and I'm sincerely sorry that we couldn't satisfy you in this case because of several issues. I apologize for any shortcomings or rudeness and hope you will give us another chance. Our goal is to provide an excellent experience to every guest, every time.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager

Summary: Initially we booked in here due to what we thought was a reasonable price for the Huntington area. However, upon arrival we soon discovered this motel is not in Huntington at all (rather 10km out), and does not have an ocean view either. The motel itself felt very dirty, and the staff there were the rudest we have ever encountered. The lady who checked us in was incredibly rude and left us all wanting to leave: we would have too if we hadn’t already paid for the motel through bookings.com. We noticed on trip advisor that people were claiming they had never got their $200 deposit back, so when we left we asked them when we would get our deposit back to which the man pretty much shrugged us off. We got our deposit back eventually, but it is worth noting this deposit fee isn’t
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thanks for taking time to comment about your stay here which didn’t meet your needs. Your comments help us improve. I'm terribly sorry you had a bad experience with us. Your experience isn't an indication of how we usually do business, and I regret that we didn't do better for you and that you felt you were treated rudely. You deserve a room and experience that meets your needs and exceeds your expectations, and we'll work to do better in the future.   Sincerely, Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: Not in HB, in Sunset Beach, WATCH OUT $200 DEPOSIT THAT YOU WON'T GET BACK TIL FOREVER
Summary: Please do not book here, it is not in HB, it is in Sunset Beach, there is no Oceanview, the street noise is terrible, the lady who runs the place is rude and there is a $200 deposit that will take a million years to get back.  I have faxed them everyday and guess what no deposit return. WILL NEVER GO THERE AGAIN!!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thanks for taking time to comment. I'm very sorry that a problem with the location of our hotel and your deposit ruined your experience with us, and I'm equally sorry that we were not able to resolve the problem for you quickly. If any issue remains, please contact us right away. We take our commitment to our guests seriously, and I regret that we let you down. Please give us a chance to fully satisfy you.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager

Summary: Had trip booked online. Called to ask some questions and they would not help me at all. They told me to read the site I booked the hotel on. They would not even tell me what time check in was. Sounds like it is a couple that maybe own this place because the man hung up on me and then I called back and the lady was just as much as a witch. Never have I ever had dealt with a crappy place like this. So sad. Anyways canceled due to how much of a holes they were. Will always tell people how crappy they were.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for sharing your review. I’m sorry you never had the chance to stay with us an experience our professional service in person. Our staff aims to provide the highest level of hospitality to our guests through our customer service, but with the situation you describe we have fallen short and would like to apologize for inconveniences you experienced. We’ll be here for you with a better experience should you decide to try us in the future.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: never paid back 200$ deposit!! DONT COME HERE!
Summary: The price is nice and all...BUT WHATEVER YOU DO DONT COME HERE IT ISNT WORTH THE MONEY. We ordered the hotel online and we get there and there was a hidden 200$ deposit fee that was NOT on there website. So the 200$ we took for spending money was spent on a stupid deposit for this motel. The guy at the front was very rude and was not helpful AT ALL! If you use cash for the 200$ deposit they will give you your 200 back when you leave the motel. But if you pay that on a credit/debit card they are supposedly supposed to give you the money 15 days later and it should show up back in your card. Well,long story short, 1 month later and sill no 200 dollars back. Ive called them and they said it was my banks fault, which it definitely was not the banks fault. The bank had to send me a
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thanks for taking time to comment about some issued you experienced regarding your stay here in Huntington Beach. Your comments help us improve. I'm terribly sorry you had a bad experience with us. If any billing or other issues remain, please contact us for quick resolution. You deserve an experience that meets your needs and exceeds your expectations, and we'll work to do better in the future for you and for other guests.  Sincerely, Hotel Manager

Summary: Hotel is located on Pacific Coast Hwy. It's bordered between Seal Beach and Huntington Beach. There is a minimal view of the ocean if you are on the 3rd floor.  Rooms are typical of a motel. This hotel room had a small microwave, small refrigerator and a flat screen tv.   King size bed was. It bad as well as pillows. Tv actually worked pretty good. Bathroom is small where you have to "squeeze" into it due to how door opens. Mirror needs replacement as well as some of the furniture.   Is beach easily accessible?....no. Be ready to walk or take your car. Same goes for food.   Finally, this establishment requires a $200 deposit when checking in.

I had booked a room for 6 days in Jan: 2017 for my son and his girlfriend to stay in March.  Since Jan: I e-mailed Oceanview Motel several times through a booking agency and nearer the time [March] directly asking them to deduct funds for my son and his girlfriends stay as a gift from my wife and myself. No response throughout this period?? My son and his girlfriend arrived in March. Late evening, Been travelling 18hrs and the person on reception would not except my Visa Debit card because I was not present?? It took nearly 2 months & 17 days to be told. Then found out on arrival??? And to make things worse the person was rude.  My son and his girlfriend left having to find new accommodation at 9pm tired, with luggage and two surfboards in the dark!  What if this had been two

Spent two nights here with a friend who was visiting from out of town.  "Old" and "Mold" refer to the room.  "Cold" refers to the attitude of the man at the front desk.   At check in we were treated coldly and rudely. We are both college educated, retired, polite people, but he looked at us with suspicious eyes as if we were common criminals.  It was very uncomfortable!    The room (#208) was very small and old and desperately needed updating.  The microwave was on the bedside table so the surface of the table was unusable.  The frig was on the dresser next to the TV, so that surface was also unusable.  The frig was the smallest compact frig I've ever seen and we were unable to put our leftovers in it.  The sheets seemed clean but the smell of bleach was so strong it kept me

Extremely rude while trying to check in. It was clearly a family ran motel which is lovely but no excuse for the rudeness. My girlfriend and I were so uncomfortable with the lady at the front desk yelling at us  that we chose to stay somewhere else. It was also currently under some construction.

Summary Heading: Inexpensive Place to stay at the Beach
Summary: I enjoyed my stay at this motel very much.  It definitely is a budget property, so one shouldn't expect too much, but the rate was incredible for a property at the beach. $80/night.  The only thing was that they required a $200 deposit.  I've never encountered this before at any hotels. The room was small but clean, bed was very comfortable and the refrigerator and microwave in the room was helpful for my 3-day 2-night stay.  It is walking distance to the beach and to some iconic cafes (Don the Beachcomber, Woody's, Harbor Beach Cafe)   The internet services was very strong and fast, which was great because I was able to get a lot work done as well.  For the price and the location, I'll probably stay here again when I have to come to HB.

Summary Heading: Great price during the 4th of July
Summary: We decided to venture out of the desert heat (where we're from) to the beautiful scenery of Huntington Beach for the 4th of July. For obvious reasons rooms by the Pier were 400 and above...way above! Since we were only spending a short time there we opted for the cheaper route. We're much more accustomed to luxury hotel stays and this place did not deliver our expectations by any means. BUT I understand you get what you pay for. The front desk was kind and accommodating I'll give them that. As far as the room, it stunk of mildew and was not comfortable whatsoever. Don't let the pictures online of this place fool you...it's nothing as advertised. But for a quick cheap stay I guess it works.

Summary Heading: DIRTY, RUDE, DISGUSTING WORST PLACE IVE EVER STAYED
Summary: DO NOT STAY HERE! After hours of traveling we arrived late, we checked in at the front desk (which stinks of curry) the Indian lady was blunt and rude she took my id and credit card out of my sight which I assume she was taking a copy of? When we got to our ground floor room we noticed the window was open which put me on edge, we soon discovered on entering the room it smelt of vomit! We was so tired after putting on fans leaving the door open for 5 mins and using my deodorant spray to make the smell better  we crashed out.   In the morning I was so disgusted and angry with myself for even putting up with such POOR HYGIENE levels, you could still smell the sick and my boyfriend found uncleaned sick on the bathroom floor. I confronted the women In then morning she apologised and

Rude woman who took liberties with my credit cards and personal information. Once inside the room it was so bad that I left with no refund and checked in a more suitable place. There was drug use, the cleanliness was beyond poor. The TV didn't work or the WI Fi

Room fee is cheap than other hotel around here. And we hope to stay by the sea. Location is really good. I think there is good hotel. I recommend . And the room has a microwave.  But a little dirty.especially,towels have a plot.not so clean.  Thank you ! I will come here again.  タオルが若干汚かったが、部屋の雰囲気も小さいながら可愛らしく、満足です。 アメリカのホテルはとにかく値段が高い、、、 海へのアクセスも簡単です。 まあまあ満足です。

I booked last minute and it was wonderful!!! It smelled clean from the moment I walked in the door. The housekeeper had done a wonderful job!!!!! Floors and bathroom were spotless!! The king size bed had beautiful sheets and comforter!!!  It had a microwave, fridge, coffee maker and snacks by the bed. Could not have asked for more. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!!

Got to the hotel to check in and the rude woman behind the desk of this really poor motel photocopied my driving licence and credit cards without asking if it was ok to do so. I ripped the photo copy up in front of them and told them I don't want to stay there. She started arguing with me and saying as long as you don't give your ss number out its ok. They wouldn't refund my money and I lost $60.00. I didn't even get the room. There were people loitering outside the hotel also. I ended up stopping at a model 6 next to Newport Beach for less money. I really don't think it's legal for them to photo copy a government id and credit catd.

A view of the ocean?  Somebody's laugh'in.  You couldn't sea the ocean from the roof of the third story.  Hospitality?  These folks either don' t know what it is or it's time for a career change.  Free wifi?  It's got it but my devices couldn't connect. Plus if you say you're a non-smoker they still charge your credit card $200 as a deposit that you aren't lying.

Great bed, excellent service at check in, clean room, good location - my experience was not at all like that of those recent reviewers who have come out with guns blazing.  Yes, there are no amenities (except toiletries and coffee and free wifi), and yes, the property is on a busy highway, but I will likely be back, based on being near the water in a sought after location.

This was an awful place. Basic room and would not have expected this in California. Thank god it was one night only as we had to unexpectedly find a Motel. Don't ever come here, and it stunk of CURRY!!!! The one thing that was nice was the ocean was just over the other side of the road

I have never been treated so rudely before by a hotel manager.  She supposedly voided my transaction and decided it was a good idea to wake me up at 11 pm to make come down to run my card again.  She did not void the charge I had to call my bank to take care of it. She never once apologized. The rooms are extremely small and there are no services. For the price of 192.00 a night I would expect to at least be treated like a human being.

Summary Heading: Absolutely worst hotel experience. I wouldn't recommend this garbage even to my worst enemy
Summary: Beginning of the trip started in a really bad way. We reserved a room for two nights for 190$ via booking.com, but when we came, an extremely rude and mental Indian receptionist said that we must pay 270$ for one night! She charged 540$ for that piece of garbage. For that much money, you can to Hilton or Mariott. Don't visit it, you will get robbed. Even forgetting that, room was horrible and not that clean. I couldn't hear anyone in the room, because of the nearby highway. Noise was so loud that I had to sleep with earplugs, absolutely unbearable. Staff was extremely rude and disrespectful to their customers, especially middle aged Indian woman. You cannot see ocean at all from their so called motel. I would recommend this garbage only if you like arguing with rude staff and

We arrived late at night to be greeted by a receptionist who told us that being on a super busy main road was one of the things you had to put up with for being near the beach.  All rooms face the road and the traffic noise is full on all night even with ear plugs. The exterior of the hotel is shabby pealing paint and faded sign. Ocean view is a bit of an exaggeration you can glimpse a tiny bit of the ocean across the main road behind the front row houses. The rooms are large probably the only positive. My basin had a huge crack in it, the bath room smelt of wee, the in room fridge was sitting on an old towel and the paint was pealing off it.  I don't really have anything good to say about this place. It is like something out of a bad American road movie and it is not even

We stayed here because it was the only place that had a vacancy. We were met with a scowl upon checking in. Once in our room we discovered a pizza box left by the previous tenant and somehow missed by housekeeping. There was never any "Sorry about that". The furnishings were typical Goodwiil fare, scratched up or missing parts. And we paid $256 for this? The air conditioning sounded like it was working hard but to no avail.

do not stay here. do not stay here . people need to know this . its a scam . no ocean view , 20 minutes drive to Huntington beach ..its a trick to get people stay here ..we came the second week of July 2015 was a high season fr California , we have no place to go and paid 150,00 a night for this trashy hotel. This hotel used to b motel 6, now owned by Indian (India) family. ck in only 1 room key allow house hold even if u have 3 or 4 members. inside the room , towels were rusty old, shampoo soap 99 cents. when ck out, they want your room key back before they give out your receipt. this is usa, not back in the 20 s boonies and we paid 150. 00 for a night ..we stayed 2 nights booked thru booking.com. everything micro managment . do not stay here and please do not make the same

Summary Heading: large black bugs outside the room
Summary: Only two towels provided, no tissues, no hairdryer, bureau with drawer removed and not there, Chinese noodles on the floor, ocean view is between buildings across the street and a very little view from one room.  Person at the desk was quite rude.  No amenities.

Stayed here for four nights on a trip visiting the area. Though it was not a luxury hotel, for the price and location I was very impressed and had zero complaints about my stay. The room was clean and had minifridge, microwave, coffeemaker ect.. I read the negative reviews before visiting and was worried but I had zero issues. The staff may have been rude as other guests say but the only time I delt with them was at check in and out and they seemed fine to me. There is some street noise but with the ac on I didn't hear it at all at night. I was impressed and if I make a trip back to the area I will stay here again.

Summary Heading: we squinted at the narrow 2 metre gap across a road and between a row of houses that was in fact our ocean view!
Summary: Well we thought, let's not judge a book by a cover!  Go to check in and it seems like we've caused an inconvenience by making a booking, turning up on the day of the booking, then handing over money to pay for the booking. In other words, the staff member wasn't very polite nor welcoming.  However, my view of this staff member was soon dissipated with the words 'you've been upgraded to an ocean view room - for free'. Excellent I me and my girlfriend thought.   The excitement didn't last long and soon turned to laughter as we squinted at the narrow 2 metre gap across a road and between a row of houses that was in fact our ocean view! Some upgrade eh!  The room was fine in size, but two lights didn't work, the bathroom area was a tad grubby and the road was actually quite noisy at

We did not even get past the front check in. The women at the front desk was the rudest person I have ever met. The front lobby was foul smelling. Any questions asked were promptly cut off and not answered appropriately. By far the most horrible display of customer service. I was about to pay and decided against it as the women continued to be rude. I pulled my card out of the machine and requested my personal information be returned to me. This was denied. The location is not as described on the site. You are across a busy street and there is a large wall built allowing no ocean view.

The hotel is located 7 miles away from Huntington Beach. Staff is very rude, place smells bad , furniture is all bit up. For some reason they  had the fridge unplugged. No ocean  view. They copy your id and credit card when you check in who knows why. Light fixture barely works you have to shake it couple time.  Beer bottles laying outside. Just a horrible place I will never go back. I rather  pay a little more and get a cleaner place.......

Located along a freeway-like section of PCH in Sunset Beach (not really Huntington Beach), this small motel run by an Indian family offers good value - with some trade-offs for road noise & deep-down cleanliness. Bring earplugs in order to sleep. Appreciated the in-room coffeemaker, small fridge & microwave. Bed was comfortable enough. New HD flatscreen TV with many channels.

This was one of the only hotels we have been to that left complimentary snacks which was nice after a long flight. We found it hard to communicate with the staff and they didn't seem to worried about what we wanted but the room was big and clean. Quite basic. I would suggest you need a car as it is on a main road and the good beaches are quite far away.

Summary Heading: A GREAT value and very very clean
Summary: I used to stay here a lot because it was under $80 per night and I could run on the beach in the morning. If you stay on the third floor you can actually see the ocean over the house tops. I was in room 311 and it has been renovated.  They got smart and put in hardwood floors and tile.  It was really clean, new shower and white super clean linens.  I talked to a man that was staying there and he has been there for months working out of town and said it cannot be beat.  So I asked the owner why all the bad reviews.  Well there are people that get angry because they cannot do what they please like smoke and make a lot of noise in the room.  Because it is cheap I am sure the partiers want to raise a ruckus here so they get on line and make a complaint.  I review for TripAdvisor a

I booked a two night stay at this establishment hoping the reviews were exaggerated however they were not. My experience at Oceanview Motel was extremely discouraging. First, my party was greeted by the office staff who were curt and inhospitable. Instead of being greeted with a common courtesy, she demanded my identification and credit card (very rude).  We were then sent to the 3rd floor directly in front of the elevator. I promptly went back to the office requesting a different room but she spoke over me declaring she could not fulfill the request with no sensitivity. We were then phoned and told we must take showers before our departure time on Monday because the gas was being shut off. In asking for further explanation, she spoke over me insisting it was out of her hands

Awful rooms stink like mold the plumbing leaked. Rude workers I asked for an extra pillow,  the attitude got worse, I was treated as an interruption to them instead of a guest that paid good money for a room.

My boyfriend and I booked this motel trying to save money while visiting a friend in Huntington Beach. The lady at the front desk was so rude, barely spoke English, and insisted that we use a debit card (instead of the credit card we booked with). When we explained that we needed to pay with a credit card, she ridiculously went into the back room and ignored us. I've never experienced such rude, foul customer service. Luckily we were able to cancel the hotel and not have to stay. I guess I can't say what the room was like because we never even stepped foot inside... But judging by the service I wouldn't step foot into this motel if you can help it! It's not even that close to Huntington Beach... Spend the extra money and don't stay here!

good points-bed,location,price,towels,minimally clean,good parking,  bad points-light didn't work above sink,flat screen too small,bathroom clean but tiny,traffic noise when u open window,hard to find,

Summary Heading: Front Office Rude and Argumentative when trying to get basic information
Summary: I was reading information on Hotels.com, Expedia.com etc regarding this Motel. I called the Motel directly to inquire about "Mandatory" Cleaning Fees $300 listed on the booking websites.  Front office person was rude, argumentative, continuously cut me off, and would not listen to my questions.  I finally asked her if she wanted me to just book and stay somewhere else instead of discussing it further. She claims I was looking at One (1) bad review, I stated I was not looking at a review but looking at the actual reservation booking sites of Hotels.com and Expedia.com fine print.  One bad review does not bother me, it could have been a bad day for that person.  However, exhorbitant "Mandatory" fees listed on the reservation booking websites does bother me.  Please be cautious

I booked at the last minute on Travelocity noting this was a 3 star hotel with an Ocean View. This place is a dump.  The room smelled terrible, the orange "spa" (in the bathroom that had only 1 dim light bulb working) was something out of the mid seventies. I wore my flip flops to shower, but would no more sit in that bacteria ridden jacuzzi than I would in a sewer. The furniture was broken and there was a gap in the door that could allow all sorts of creepy crawlers in. Ocean View? Hardly.   Just don't.

Stayed here for our anniversary. Good place to stay if your not expected extravagant. The people who checked us in/out were nice. The do how ever need a new maid, the shower had dirty spots. Other then that it was okay.

Horrible staff, stay away, rude and unprofessional. When i quoted  lady the hotel room price she asked for how many people, I replied 2, but she didn't believe me and went to look at the car I was driving. Really?   I look up the price online and it was cheaper than what they quoted me in person, so I said it's ok I'll just book it online. They say go ahead and try. While I was booking it on smart phone they have increased it online as well. I mean they have changed it right in front of me, like I couldn't see what they were doing.  So I stayed at the hotel next door.  Too bad for them.

Wow...what a poor excuse for lodging. They, of course, put a hold on our charge card when we checked in for "incidentals". Except there are no "incidentals." No pay channels on the tv, no in-room bar...nothing extra is offered, yet they take the money and hold it. There was a little dish holding a few dubious-appearing candies in our room and I made certain to photograph it upon arrival in the event they claimed we took any of them. The room was Spartan. The toilet paper was...get this...MADE IN CHINA. That about sums it up here...except for the fact that it is not a short walk to the beach.  The first place you can cross the Pacific Highway is over .35 miles away and another .4 miles to the beach.  The elevator was out of service and the husband-owner had pieces and tools all

Summary Heading: No ocean view but not a bad deal
Summary: Stayed there for 2 nights, was a bit noisy cuz right by the highway but quite clean and well maintained.  There is an elevator, which is nice when you have a big suitcase and your room is on the 3rd floor! No oceanview! But at least it's only a quick drive to the laundromat or a grocery store, which is always nice for travelers. On another hand it's pretty far from LA. In general it was pretty ok, you don't expect a 4 stars when you book a motel but it was pretty good and fair, the microwave coffee maker and fridge come really handy too

Summary Heading: Consider the price and set your expectation
Summary: I stayed here in March for two nights and, after booking, read some reviews which had me worried, but when I arrived I found they didn't match up to my experience.  I paid £72 for two nights. Sure the motel's right on the main Pacific Coast Highway and it was quite noisy and a little walk from the beach, but it was clean, pretty comfortable and the shower was more effective than the one in my $235 a night hotel in Santa Monica had been!   Initially the sound of cars passing (and idiots blaring their horns) disturbed me, but in the end I slept soundly both nights and found the bed very comfortable. I could see the sea from my 3rd floor room, but that was a bonus really.   I found the owners polite and very helpful, contrary to some of the reviews here. Perhaps some reviews reaped

This place was horrible, the lady working check in was rude and the parking lot is tiny. There is no view of the ocean, the room was disgusting, it smelled musty and the Walls had chipped paint all over, the mirror looked like someone took a razor blade to it, there is constant loud traffic noise literally all night. Don't plan on getting visitors to your rm because the rude lady will charge you extra, if the room is messy when you leave, they'll charge you extra. Trust me GO SOMEWHERE ELSE probably the worst hotel I have ever been too

We stayed here because it was the least expensive place near the beach.  We were told, by the owner, that they are "steps from the beach."  In reality they are a half mile walk from the beach.  Our room was on the third floor, so we did have a view of the ocean between houses across PCH.  That is a very busy road and the noise was pretty loud until very late at night.  Because the address is Huntington Beach, we had difficult finding this place.  It is actually on the edge of Huntington Beach and Sunset Beach.  There is a long, high wall across the PCH from the Ocean View that eliminates any hope of a view from the ground or second floor.  It is this same LONG wall that requires guests to walk blocks to the nearest traffic light, cross the PCH and then walk two blocks to the

I came to "Huntington" (the motel WAS NOT in Huntington, nor was it in view of the ocean) to meet up with a group of girlfriends, only 2 of us were staying in the motel. Yes we are 19 and 20 but had no intention of being rowdy and partying, especially in that small dump. Upon arrival the owner was incredibly rude to me, did not believe me about the number of guests staying in the room so proceeded to take it upon herself to walk out to our car and examine how many people were in it. Because I'm young she tried to nickel and dime me with anything she could. She then called my MOTHER to confirm the number of girls staying. Before leaving to settle in the room her last comment to me was "NO PARTYING". I feel as if something along the lines of "enjoy your stay" would have been more

We also booked on Priceline and did not even get into the room.  No office staff for 20 minutes, then when we spoke w/office staff they were rude.  Was not given a refund either.  Be smart and do not stay here.  the scenery is not what you think......shame on you Oceanview Motel.

We stayed here based on suggestions from family members.  When we arrived they had just purchased a new key system and had not learned how to make keys so they finally got us a key that worked.  The phones did not work and we were not able to contact the other family members staying at the hotel.  We were put on a bottom floor with a view of the street.  The room smelled of smoke and there was a microwave thrown onto a chair in the corner of the room.  The hotel is right on a very busy street and the noise lasted all night.  There were no views of the ocean from any floor and it was 2 blocks to the beach across the busy highway.  It was within walking distance of some restaurants but they did not look very inviting.  The hotel was a long way from Huntington Beach and in fact was

Very rude staff, had an emergency trying to reach some family staying here and staff wouldnt even give us their room # so had to drive 2 hrs to get to them instead of just calling and having them head home. Very disappointed and upset with the staff!!!!!!!! Very RUDE PEOPLE

Summary Heading: Found a bug if some kind in our bedding
Summary: Kind of loud from traffic found a bug in our bedding a cockroach i think and our room was cleaned late like 4 pm and after funding that bug done cleaning and setting up new bedding at 8 pm with no discount or anything. I wont stay there again.

Showed up an hour early, was told if I wanted to check in there was a 25,00 fee. I asked what the fee would be to cancel the reservation and the rude lady said full price! Hairs all over the bath tub, door broken off the frame, bugs in the bed. Spend a little extra money and don't stay here

Summary Heading: You had better bring a GPS and a cooler
Summary: First, this dump is found in Sunset Beach, it might be in the HB zipcode but plan to go to the water tower in Sunset and you will find it. I called for directions to find a surly woman from a call center who was no wiser until I told her I was passing the water tower (local landmark).  The premises are old and although they are trying hard, it shows. It is cheap, as other people have mentioned, but the inability to sleep (PCH is steps from your door) makes it no bargain.  If you are focused on the beach, it's a fair price for the proximity. Remember however that fellow partyers will make life tough on you late at night as the walls are thin.  Something that creeped me out also was the way that my toiletries were moved out of the shower every day. I got the feeling that my things

Me and my boyfriend were on a road trip through the west coast. We've stayed there for two nights, because of our friends wedding. It was cheap, clean, and close to the beach (and to the wedding :). But I wouldn't recommend it for a longer stay. Every morning about 9-11 a.m. the lady who was a manager was walking around the motel and staring through the windows. When I asked her why does she do it - she told me she was checking if there are people in the room, beacuse she wanted to know if they checked out already. It was very stupid - you have the check-in and check-out time - so you don't have to spy on people! That's why I think it was good only for a night.

Love the Ocean View Motel....You simply will not find a fresher cleaner option in the OC on PCH no less...#rd floor has Ocean Views from just about every room...Rooms are clean fresh upon check in ( not musty and moldy smelling like most properties in this price range...Great value with full cableincluding HBO ( 80 channels..! ) mini fridge, coffe maker, microwave with comp popcorn...Gotta love it..Convienient to everthing ( restaurants, shopping beach is right there)I would reccomend the Ocean View to anyone..!!

Summary Heading: Cheap and close to the beach.
Summary: This motel isnt the bees knees, but it is the best value for how much your paying. Its the only hotel around 60$ a night thats actually anywhere near walking distance to a beach. I stayed at 2 other hotels while in los angelas and this one was by far the best deal considering your only 5 minute hop skip and a jump from seal beach/ long beach area. If your looking for something nicer than pay more money and go else where, but if your looking to be close to the surf and decent shops this place is great. Little disapointed that they accused us before we even checked in for being rowdy young people... my boyfriend had to work at 4 am every morning so we were far from being the partying type. plus they over charged me each night i stayed longer but when i told them that they said

Summary Heading: Not sure it was worth the money!
Summary: Granted, we were staying on a Saturday night, in August, so the price was more than I would have liked to pay, but I have to say I was quite disappointed with the trip. I blame Expedia for not letting me know that there is only one bed (queen or king) in the room, ESPECIALLY after telling the agent we were bringing our 5-yr-old grandson. We did not find out until arrival about the sleeping arrangements.  Kudos are given to the staff member who tried very hard to help us out, and although we agreed to it then, it was not truly acceptable. We had arrived early, our king-sized room was not ready. We asked if there was someplace to change so we could head to the beach, and then come back later for the room. There was no place to do that, but she could give us a queen-sized at that

Summary Heading: CAME IN OUR ROOM WHILE WE WERE SLEEPING!!!
Summary: horrible... we complained and they walked away! we went in the office and they shut the door on us! they were completely rude! it is not clean what so ever.. i found dirty used raggs and tissues in the night stand drawer!!! my husbands brother and wife came to visit and the owner said they could only stay for 10-15 mins!!! i locked the door on double lock and the next morning i looked and the door was unlocked and the tv was off! i asked my husband if he did it but he didnt!!! staff was horrible... came in our room after we said no cleaning and we came back from the beach and stuff was rearranged (not in a clean way either) we reserved 2 nights and couldnt stay the next night... tried to get our money back for the next night and they refused to!! go to any other hotel/motel than

What's not to like-very nice staff and owners, clean room, comfy bed, fabuous shower, micro wave and fridge.... but most important! less then 5 min walk to beautiful beach... 2 doors down from Don The Beachcomber for 'Reggae For A Reason Sunday's', minutes from Harbor House Cafe for great, cheap and healthy eats and lot's of other dining choices,beach sky light and some view, quiet at night...but for us it was all about the beach, The Beachcomber, the great rates, not having to drive during stay and feeling safe and comfortable while enjoying. We'll be back.

Summary Heading: It has an ocean view from the third floor.
Summary: A bit noisy from the heavy road traffic but that settles down later in the evening when you want to sleep.  The beds were super comfortable and the room was really clean.

OceanView motel is my new favorite motel. Its nestled in a very cool beach community and is run by a very nice family.  Like BD said its surounded by all kinds of great resturants. you can walk 10 mins to the harbor for kayaking or stand up paddle surfing, or just walk across the street to lounge and play in the sand. the rooms were very comfortable and they all have flat screen tv's,microwaves and a mini fridge. Id be hard pressed to find a hotel as nice and for such  great value.

Summary Heading: Low Budget Vacation in Huntington Beach
Summary: OceanView Motel is a clean humble place to stay, and the family that runs the operation is very kind and respectful. Take a stroll to the beach, have a rest....listen to a band at Don the Beachcomber, or have a meal (all kinds: Indian, Chinese, breakfast spots, Mexican, Hamburgers). Attitude of Gratitude is the basic key to happiness, and this place could help make your vacation recharging.
Liked that it was less then a 5 min walk to the beach. Service was great for the price. Would stay again
Stayed at a couple other hotels nearby also but the combination of value along with great service and cleanliness of the rooms made Ocean View the best.

Dirty room with a very unprofessional staff.  Requested and booked a room with two full beds and was "upgraded" to a single king which which I didn't want sleep with my bro in the same bed... Refused to let me talk with the owner saying he was "traveling" out of the country.  100% Dissatisfied.  Rooms also smelt bad, but the check in office smelt the worst.  Bags or dirty laundry all over the ground level side walk.  It would be a stretch to send my worst enemys to this dive of a motel.  Also I does not have an Ocean View.. Maybe twenty years ago, but now its back behind many residential homes and other buildings.

The owners at this motel are RUDE!!! They watch your every move! Because I had a guest meet me at the motel to take me to dinner they locked me out of my room! Told me I broke the rules and If I wanted visitors to meet them at the bar! They told me they even took pictures. Oh my goodness...I've never experienced such terrible people. I decided to just leave a day early and still got charged for the night! Whatever you do stay away! It's cheap but not worth it. I'm even wondering if they have cameras inside the rooms.

Summary Heading: A clean place to stay the night while enjoying the area.
Summary: This Hotel was very clean; carpets, tile floors in the bathroom, toilet, tub & sink. The bed is comfortable and the heater/A.C work very well.   Absolutely no bugs here and it's not gross. The room had a little bit of a musky smell but when you are near the ocean, things get ruined so it's just something to expect with salty air.   Parking was great, lighting was good & even an elevator! Most older places don't have those. I am wearing a boot on my foot and didn't have to walk up the stairs.   The television is big with a nice selection of shows. Working fridge & microwave with a basket filled with: popcorn, mints & crackers.   Handsoap was provided along with coffee and tea.  Overal, I'm pretty impressed an would definitely stay here again! Just a little walk to Don the

Summary Heading: I stay here eveytime I visit Orange County
Summary: I really enjoy this property, it is a nice clean, quiet place to stay.  The showers are great-good water pressure. It is the perfect place to stay if you are just looking for room near the beach. Close to Seal Beach, Long Beach and Huntington beach. It is not full of amenities, it is a really nice place to stay at affordable prices. I have stayed in the jacuzzi room but they can be humid for a while if you use it. I recommend this place for a good night sleep.

The rooms are cheap....that is the best thing they have going for them,  the furniture is mismatched and the rooms have a smell about them. we stayed there to save money and decided that it will be the last time we stay there. It is worth the few extra dollars to get a room that feels clean and safe.

Let me begin with the negatives: if you want a quiet room and/or an ocean view, the Oceanview Motel is not for you.  The motel is located very close to Pacific Coast Highway, so guests at the Oceanview Motel have to put up with traffic noise all night and all day.  And except for a few rooms on third and maybe the second floor of the motel, the homes on the beach side of PCH block the view of the ocean.    However, my wife and I found the traffic noise to be "white noise" that didn't interrupt our sleep.  And for the price we paid - $50 a night including tax - we didn't really expect an ocean view. (My guess is that the motel is older than the homes, so many years ago there probably was an ocean view from this motel.)    For those $50 you will get a comfortable king-size bed, TV

Summary Heading: It's only a motel, but it's clean and friendly
Summary: The first thing to say is that the name is misleading. Even Basil Fawlty with his telescope would have difficulty spotting the ocean from the third floor. Having said that, there are a lot of bad reviews on here about the rooms and the staff but I had no problems at all. It's a motel, and it's better than a lot of chain motels I have stayed at in the past. Fridge, microwave, coffee in room (free popcorn!). Quick wifi with multiple locations. Clean rooms and bathrooms, and friendly staff. It's not in Huntington beach, it's closer to Seal beach, but you can see that from the map. The area seems safe enough at night, there are a few bars and restaurants nearby. It's a short walk to sunset beach. It's right on the highway, you you will get some traffic noise, but the windows are

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We got this room bc there was a festival and this was the last place with one room left. Rate was only $65 bucks a night but the motel stunk and there was no toliet paper but the bathroom was very nice. Big shower new tile

Summary Heading: Friendly staff but just so-so overall.
Summary: The good: The staff, which seems to be composed of a family living on the ground floor of the motel, were friendly and provided some good restaurant recommendations. Nice amenities provided: free WiFi, decent cable lineup, mini-fridge, microwave, little basket of snacks (crackers, popcorn). Lots of space to store things in the room.   The not-so-good: My biggest complaint about this property is that they asked us to change rooms for the second night of our stay, despite the fact we had booked two nights in advance. We weren't comfortable leaving our luggage in the new room while it was being cleaned, as we noticed the doors in the unoccupied suites seem to be left open all day (perhaps to air them out?) and felt more secure leaving the luggage in the car. At least  they have an

Summary Heading: We had a great time! We would definitely stay here again
Summary: Let's face it, who can afford to stay at the Hyatt or Hilton in Huntington Beach? Even the Sun and Sands Motel is over $100 a night!  The Oceanview Motel was fine. The room was clean, it didn't smell bad, it smelled clean. The bathroom was clean, the sheets and bed covers were clean and very colorful!  The lady at the front desk was very nice and even gave my husband, who is a smoker, an ash tray to use outside the room (we asked for a nonsmoking room). We didn't care if we could see the ocean or not, we knew we were close to it. I am a travel agent and I stay at alot of different hotels and motels and The Oceanview Motel is a good deal for what you are paying for. It's not fancy, there is no continental breakfast, but it was clean, it was quiet, and the people running it were

Summary Heading: Excellent stay.  Ignore thoses negative reviews.  I'm coming back.
Summary: I read all the negative reviews about this place, and I suppose if you're the Pierponts, and have more money than God, you should stay at a "ritzier" place.  I don't have money.  This place came up on Expedia, and I booked it first, then read the reviews later.  I was a little nervous about the stay, but am now quite content.  All of the comments about the staff here, I feel, are unfair.  It's a family that stays here, and runs the place.  I needed contact solution, and the lady at the front desk, offered to drive up to the pharmacy and get it for me, which she did.  That's service.  Everything that I needed, I got.  Hair-dryer, extra pillows, resaraunt recommendations.   The place isn't the Beverly Hilton, but it's not $1000 per night either.  The "Ocean View"  is a brief shot,

We booked our reservations online for this hotel. When we arrived at the hotel we noticed a great amount of the room doors were open.  From the street, this looked as though the rooms were occupied and nobody had air conditioning.  We parked and went into the office to check in.  The gentleman gave us a room key and said that the door to our room was open and to just "go on up".  I reserved a room with a jetted tub, and the room we were given did not have one.  Back to the office, I showed the man our printed reservation and asked for a room with a jetted tub. He was polite, apologized and gave us the key to room 205.  Again, we walked up and the door was open, as were every door to every vacant room.  We inspected the room and seen that it was what we had reserved on the

I recently spent two nights at the Oceanview while visiting my aunt and cousin after my uncle passed away.  I liked the following about the motel: 1.   The big newer TV and  remote (contrary to reviews I did not have to pay a deposit for a remote).  2.  The large Holiday Inn Express like shower head and the HOT shower.  3.  The convenient refrigerator and my clean room.  4.  The nice new comfortable mattress on my King size bed.  5.  The friendly staff.    6.  The low cost I paid adding this stay to my Travelocity flight and rental car itinerary.  This property has addressed some of the concerns mentioned in previous reviews and deserves to be looked at by the value-conscious traveller staying in Huntington Beach.

This place is not great at all. Firstly I must say - it is in a very bad location. It cost us 20 dollars in a taxi one way to go to main street or the place in huntington beach where there is things going on. There was one friendly staff member, a man.The main woman at the desk is so unfriendly its not even funny. The room wasn't too bad - there was hot water and it was clean but still looked old. Oh don't be fooled - there is no oceanview!! Im not suprised there was a sign up saying "vacancy" the whole time we were there!

If you are looking for a cheap place to sleep this is fine.  Do not expect under any circumstances any kind of extras.   The man that I assumed run the place was actually cordial, but the younger lady and older couple were extremely rude.  The best thing about this place is that it is in walking distance of the ocean and The Harbor House Cafe, great place, great food and great people.  Probably wont stay here again.

I read the reviews on this place and they pretty much sucked, but we decided to be positive anyway. NOT A SMART THING TO DO! when we first got there, the management were RUDE and stupid, THEN! they only gave us one bed when we specifically asked for two, and had to pay 20 dollars extra to switch rooms. The rooms smell  old disgusitng moldy and smokey .  We had to run the AC constantly in order to SOMEWHAT avoid the smell.  The blankets were stained, there were random holes in the walls, and there were disgusting brown stains ALL OVER THE BATHROOM!!!!  there were also mold stains  all over the shower curtain. AND!!! there was a HUGE cockroach crawling around the floor!!! NEVER EVER STAY HERE!!!! EVER! its not worth the money.  I would rather sleep outside on the street.
If you are staying at a motel expect a motel. This is Orange County, if you wish to visit here expect to pay up, no exceptions. Why would anyone even stay in a motel!!

This place was so cheezy!! Everything was run down, the operators living there were extremely rude  and not willing to give a partial refund when we woke up to discover no power in the room. She implied that we must have done something to cause it instead. She did offer another room, but we just wanted to leave because everything else was so crappy.  There was no "ocean view" because there were houses in the way. The "spa" was a cheezy tub w jets and there was no ventilation in the bathroom, so you overheat quickly and it steams up the entire room even w the window open at night. The TV was so staticky, the room was so small, you have to squeeze sideways to get in the chair at the table. It was not very clean. There were electrical wires hanging from the ceiling. Not that we

Summary Heading: Sleep with the homeless before you stay here
Summary: This motel is not represented accurately on the hotel.com web site.  It was listed as a Hotel when in reality it is a motel.  The clean linen and towels were stacked up in the oil drenched parking lot.   Part of the reason we used hotels.com to book this trip is because they advertise that they have been there to actually see the facility.  I find it very interesting that everything about this motel on the hotels.com web site has been changed since my call to their customer service department.   As a result of this we decided not to stay in this motel.  Please be aware that even though hotels.com has no signature proving that we stayed there they still billed me for the entire amount.  Also, after making a formal complaint to the customer service department at hotel.com still

I’m can only attest to my own experience there, but I though this hotel was just fine. It wasn’t the nicest, but it was nice enough. I never saw any bugs, or odd stains on the sheets. It wasn’t too loud for me to sleep. We didn’t have full cable, but that wasn’t a huge deal, still had HBO and the basics. The people who run the hotel maybe lacked some people skills, but I’ll take a genuine person over a big fake smile any day. Besides, the hotel right next door, who got similarly crappy reviews charged twice as much per night. I wouldn’t recommend this for a two week family vacation or anything, but for the basic no-frills traveler, this place is great.

Visited between June 15 - 18, 2006.  There was mold on the inside of the shower curtains, white stains on their green blanket (very suspicious), the fridge had an AWFUL smell, the TV was useless because there was static on most of the channels, and  bed was uncomfortable.  Overall, it was unsanitary and unsatisfying.  To top it all off, management was rude and non-welcoming.  I've stayed at other motels that were around $70/ night, and I was more satisfied.  I would highly reccomend you pay a little more for something better.

For our 9 day vacation in So. Calif., we wanted to stay at a motel near the Ocean, but didn't have a lot of money to spend.  We found the Oceanview Motel on the internet and couldn't believe the price, $69.00 a night!  What a deal, but could it be true? I decided to do a little research and got some extremely mixed reviews, especially on Expedia.  Considering the price, and the fact that it was close to the ocean, we decided to go with the nicer reviews and make the best of it.  When we first got there, a lady came up to us and told us that this place was a dump and to get our money back.  However, in listening to her boyfriend, it was obvious that the couple were trying to scam the motel and get a 3 hour stay for free.  So, with a little trepidation, we signed in and went

I was very surprised to find a hotel on PCH in Huntington Beach for under $100! The location was excellent but the hotel was pretty bad! It had a horrible smell and was very dirty. The owners downstairs were very shady! I didn't expect too much for the price but will pay a little more next time for something more comfortable.

Summary Heading: One Star?  Should have been a Quarter of a Star.....
Summary: The truth of the matter is, this place isn't great.  One star is being nice.  It was somewhat clean, the room was rather small, and of course, if you really want an ocean view, don't stay here.  I've lived in the area before, so I have seen the motel on passing when I went to friends houses.  When I booked, I figured what the hey, its by a favorite Irish pub of mine, and was not too far from our hotel in Anaheim after a few days at Disneyland.  First off, if you want your phone on, or if you want a remote control, its a ten dollar deposit for each, now, I have a cell, so who needs the phone, and the room was small enough that you don't need a remote, but be forewarned.  The establishment is family run, and they live in the property.  They were not unfriendly, but they were not

This was perhaps the worst hotel experience I have ever had.  The staff, one family that lived on-site, was extremely rude and unhelpful.  Employees entered my room after I declined cleaning service, even though the do not disturb sign was placed on the door.  I was charged the same deposit twice, for a remote control, and was never given compensation for the deposit  that they took from me in cash.  In fact, management denied ever taking the deposit from me in the first place.  Whatever you do, do not give them a credit card number for incidentals, this is what they used to charge me a bogus $10 AFTER I had left the hotel, even though the remote control was returned to the office.  The accommodations are shabby, and there is NO OCEAN VIEW.  The ocean is only within walking

COMPLETE disaster! We stayed there four nights and even when we called to verify the reservation after booking it online the owner was rude. There is NO oceanview, its on a noisy busy street. Next door to the motel is an auto body shop so you will hear motors and loud engines early in the AM. The walls are PAPER THIN and when people walk down the hallways you can hear them. They are very chinsey cheap and the owners live on site. The whole parking lot smells like indian food and they cut corners everywhere. You have to beg to get extra towels and there are easily repairable dings in the walls, carpet stains and scratchy blankets with a nasty mattress. We travel often and this was the WORSE place. Far from disneyland and the attractions. OK but here is the last problem we hated:

I was very suspicious when I was able to find a hotel near Huntington Beach for under $100 a night on the PCH.  I decided to give it a shot and was very, very pleased with the Oceanview Motel.  The rooms were very clean and decent sized.  The only downfall was the lack of television stations available...only about 10 or so.  Then again if you are in wonderfull Huntington Beach, who cares how the TV is in the room!
